intro: Cyperus tenuiflorus, commonly known as slenderflower sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in wetlands and along water bodies. Cyperus tenuiflorus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
